text: yesterday I was filming a street food
video in Bangkok with my friend mark
Wiens for his YouTube channel you might
remember him from our recent video at
the floating market Cheers
man I'm melting your mouth that mango
the mango just bushes with juice this
time we went all over the district of
siloam devouring three meals for lunch
chicken rice the sauce is almost
drinkable there's brown hairs beef
noodle soup it's so aromatic
if only you could smell it and dry
noodles so they're gonna be egg noodles
which are called balmy and then it's
gonna be a whole mix apart you can see
the whole cabinet there's these
meatballs right off the lip of the ball
with the thumb but it wasn't until we
had dessert when a special guy caught my
attention on the street corner literally
the street corner
this is uncle Tokyo he gets his nickname
by selling these thin flat pancakes
which are called Colonel Tokyo
he's been rolling them up from this
exact stall in this exact location for
over 20 years what did you do before you
were making this remaking a different
kind of food Wow
talk about like mastering one kind of
food these tasty sidewalk snacks are
basically mini pancakes with either a
sweet custard cream or a savory filling
like a hot dog and so you can get a mix
of different things or you can order
just one version if you like and just
the convenience of this it's all on a
stick you never need to touch it every
morning at 10:00 a.m. he wheels his push
cart across the busy roads of Silom
Bangkok's buzzing business district
so most of his customers are hungry
businessmen and women on their lunch
break this guy is seriously not stopped
he doesn't even take a one-minute break
he serves hundreds of snacks and then
packs up his push cart at 2:00 p.m. to
go back home the lunch crowd is enough
to keep his pockets full but the thing I
love so much about uncle Tokyo besides
his passion is his humor mister
Tokyo rocking a Gucci hat only one of
the time around Bangkok you'll notice
most street vendors are dull and to
focus on making every last baht to smile
but uncle Tokyo is always laughing and
happy to serve you no matter what
oh look at this so the tip truck driver
just stopped by to get a quick roadside
snack he even led Deanna and I be the
chef without expecting any payment
although we did tip him nicely for his
generosity Dan and I just made these
ourselves oh so mushy okay it's better
when you make it yourself doesn't it if
one thing's for sure I will be stopping
by Uncle Tokyo's cars every time I'm in
the area you can find him on convent
Road at salad Eng BTS exit number two
I'm more than sure that he'd love to
serve you
token girl perfect ending he's like
literally closing the shop for the day
I'm Drew Pinsky and if you like my
travel videos please click Subscribe and
join me as I plan to visit every country
in the world
